name: Paneer Butter Masala
about: A rich and creamy North Indian curry made with paneer (cottage cheese) in a tomato-based gravy with aromatic spices.
preparationSteps: Heat butter in a pan and sauté ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Add spices and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add paneer cubes and cream.
Cook for 10 minutes on low heat.
Garnish with kasuri methi and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Biryani
about: A fragrant and flavorful rice dish made with aromatic spices, basmati rice, and a mix of fresh vegetables.
ingredients: 1 cup Mixed vegetables (carrot, beans, peas, potato)
Fresh coriander and mint for garnish
preparationSteps: Rinse and soak basmati rice for 20 minutes.
Heat ghee in a pan, sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and cook until soft.
Mix in chopped vegetables, biryani masala, turmeric, and chili powder.
Stir in yogurt, cook for 5 minutes, then add water and salt.
Add soaked rice, cover, and cook on low heat until rice is fluffy.
Garnish with fresh coriander and mint, serve hot.

name: Dal Makhani
about: A rich and creamy North Indian lentil dish made with black lentils (urad dal) and kidney beans (rajma) slow-cooked with butter, cream, and aromatic spices.
preparationSteps: Soak black lentils and kidney beans overnight, then pressure cook until soft.
Heat butter in a pan and sauté ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Add cooked lentils, spices, and simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in cream and cook on low heat for 10 more minutes.
Garnish with kasuri methi and serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Palak Soup
about: A nutritious and flavorful soup made with fresh spinach (palak), blended with spices and cream for a smooth texture.
preparationSteps: Heat butter in a pan and sauté onion and garlic until soft.
Add chopped spinach and cook until wilted.
Pour in vegetable broth and let it simmer for 5 minutes.
Blend the mixture until smooth.
Return to heat, add milk or cream, and season with salt and pepper.
Simmer for 5 minutes, then add lemon juice before serving.

name: Butter Chicken
about: A rich and creamy North Indian dish made with tender chicken cooked in a spiced tomato-butter sauce.
ingredients: 500g Chicken, boneless and cut into pieces
preparationSteps: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, chili powder, and salt for 30 minutes.
Heat butter in a pan, cook marinated chicken until lightly browned.
Remove chicken and set aside.
In the same pan, add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Stir in garam masala, kasuri methi, and cooked chicken.
Pour in heavy cream, mix well, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Chicken Biryani
about: A delicious and aromatic rice dish made with marinated chicken, basmati rice, and a blend of fragrant spices.
ingredients: Fresh coriander and mint for garnish
preparationSteps: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, chili powder, and salt for 30 minutes
Rinse and soak basmati rice for 20 minutes
Heat ghee in a pan, sauté onions until golden brown
Add tomatoes and cook until soft
Add marinated chicken and cook until browned
Stir in biryani masala, then add water or chicken broth
Add soaked rice, cover, and cook on low heat until rice is fluffy and chicken is tender
Garnish with fresh coriander and mint, serve hot

name: Fish Curry
about: A delicious and aromatic Indian fish curry made with tender fish pieces simmered in a spiced coconut or tomato-based gravy.
ingredients: 500g Fish (Pomfret, Kingfish, or any firm fish), cut into pieces
1 cup Coconut milk (or water for a lighter version)
preparationSteps: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and curry leaves, and let them splutter
Sauté onions until golden brown, then add ginger-garlic paste
Mix in tomato puree, turmeric, chili powder, cumin, and coriander powder
Cook until the oil separates from the masala
Add coconut milk and tamarind paste, mix well
Gently add fish pieces, cover, and cook for 10 minutes until tender
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander
Serve hot with steamed rice or roti

name: Prawn Masala
about: A spicy and flavorful Indian dish made with prawns cooked in a rich tomato-based masala with aromatic spices.
preparationSteps: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until fragrant
Mix in tomato puree, turmeric, chili powder, cumin, and coriander powder
Cook until the oil separates from the masala
Add prawns, salt, and cook for 5-7 minutes until they turn pink and tender
Stir in garam masala and kasuri methi, mix well
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with rice or roti

name: Gulab Jamun
about: A classic Indian dessert made from deep-fried milk-based dumplings soaked in a fragrant sugar syrup.
ingredients: 1/4 cup Milk (warm, as needed for kneading)
Oil or ghee for deep frying
preparationSteps: In a bowl, mix milk powder, all-purpose flour, and baking soda
Add ghee and mix until the mixture becomes crumbly
Gradually add warm milk and knead into a soft dough (do not over-knead)
Cover and let it rest for 10 minutes, then shape into smooth, crack-free balls
Heat oil or ghee on low-medium flame and fry the balls until golden brown
For sugar syrup: Boil sugar and water until slightly sticky, then add cardamom, rose water, and lemon juice
Add the fried gulab jamuns to the warm syrup and let them soak for at least 2 hours
Serve warm or chilled, garnished with chopped nuts if desired

name: Rasgulla
about: A soft and spongy Bengali dessert made from chhena (Indian cottage cheese) balls cooked in a light sugar syrup.
preparationSteps: Boil milk, then add lemon juice or vinegar to curdle it
Strain the curdled milk using a muslin cloth and rinse with cold water to remove acidity
Hang the chhena for 30 minutes to remove excess water
Knead the chhena for 5-7 minutes until smooth and soft
Add corn flour (if using) and knead again, then shape into small, smooth balls
In a wide pan, boil water and sugar to make syrup, adding cardamom pods
Drop the chhena balls into boiling syrup and cook covered for 15-20 minutes on medium heat
Turn off the heat and let them cool in the syrup
Add rose water if desired and refrigerate before serving chilled

name: Jalebi
about: A crispy, deep-fried Indian dessert soaked in sugar syrup, known for its spiral shape and sweet, tangy flavor.
ingredients: 1/2 tsp Turmeric or saffron for color (optional)
Oil or ghee for deep frying
preparationSteps: In a bowl, mix all-purpose flour, corn flour, yogurt, and baking soda
Gradually add warm water to make a smooth, thick batter and let it ferment for 6-8 hours
For sugar syrup: Boil sugar and water until sticky (1-string consistency), then add lemon juice, cardamom powder, and rose water
Heat oil or ghee in a pan, fill a piping bag or squeeze bottle with the batter, and pipe spirals into hot oil
Fry until golden and crisp, then dip immediately into warm sugar syrup for 30 seconds
Remove and serve hot, garnished with saffron strands or chopped nuts

name: Falooda
about: A rich and refreshing Indian dessert drink made with milk, basil seeds, falooda sev, rose syrup, and ice cream.
ingredients: 1 scoop Vanilla or kulfi ice cream
Chopped fruits (like mango or strawberry, optional)
preparationSteps: Soak basil seeds in water for 10-15 minutes until they expand
Boil falooda sev as per package instructions, then drain and cool
In a glass, add rose syrup at the bottom
Layer soaked basil seeds, cooked falooda sev, and chilled milk
Add sugar if needed and mix gently
Top with a scoop of ice cream, chopped nuts, and jelly cubes (if using)
Serve immediately with a long spoon and straw

name: Masala Chai
about: A fragrant and spiced Indian tea made by brewing black tea leaves with aromatic spices, milk, and sugar.
ingredients: 2 tsp Black tea leaves (or 2 tea bags)
preparationSteps: In a saucepan, bring water to a boil
Add crushed cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, black pepper, and grated ginger
Simmer for 2-3 minutes to infuse the flavors
Add black tea leaves and let it brew for 3-4 minutes
Pour in milk and sugar, stir well, and bring to a gentle boil
Strain the tea into cups and serve hot

name: Lassi (Sweet & Salty)
about: A refreshing and creamy yogurt-based Indian drink, available in both sweet and salty variations.
ingredients: 2 tbsp Sugar or honey (adjust to taste)
1/2 tsp Black salt (optional, for extra flavor)
preparationSteps: In a blender, add yogurt, chilled water or milk, and ice cubes
For sweet lassi: Add sugar, cardamom powder, and blend until frothy
For salty lassi: Add salt, roasted cumin powder, and blend well
Pour into glasses and garnish with nuts (for sweet) or coriander leaves (for salty)
Serve chilled and enjoy!

name: Filter Coffee
about: A rich and aromatic South Indian coffee made using a traditional filter, blended with frothy milk for a smooth and bold taste.
ingredients: 2 tbsp Ground coffee powder (South Indian filter coffee blend)
preparationSteps: Add coffee powder to the upper chamber of a traditional South Indian coffee filter
Pour hot water over the coffee and let it drip into the lower chamber (takes about 10-15 minutes)
Boil milk and mix with the brewed coffee decoction
Add sugar as per taste and mix well
Pour the coffee back and forth between two cups to create froth
Serve hot in a traditional tumbler and dabarah (small bowl) for authentic taste

name: Thandai
about: A refreshing and aromatic Indian beverage made with milk, nuts, and a blend of spices, traditionally enjoyed during festivals like Holi and Mahashivratri.
ingredients: Chilled water or ice cubes (optional, for a lighter version)
preparationSteps: Soak almonds, cashews, pistachios, poppy seeds, fennel seeds, and cardamom in warm water for 2-3 hours
Blend the soaked ingredients with black pepper and a little milk to form a smooth paste
Boil milk, add the prepared paste, and mix well
Stir in sugar, saffron, and rose water (if using), and let it cool
Refrigerate for 1-2 hours for flavors to blend
Strain (optional) and serve chilled, garnished with chopped nuts
